Sentencas: There is increasing interest in developing solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) for portable applications.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of solid oxide fuel cells operated with methanol and ethanol under direct utilization, steam reforming, dry reforming or partial oxidation conditions

Sentencas: For these devices it would be convenient to directly use a liquid fuel such as methanol and ethanol rather than hydrogen.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of solid oxide fuel cells operated with methanol and ethanol under direct utilization, steam reforming, dry reforming or partial oxidation conditions

Sentencas: The direct utilization of alcohol fuels in SOFC involves several processes, including the deposition of carbon, which can lead to irreversible deactivation of the fuel cell.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of solid oxide fuel cells operated with methanol and ethanol under direct utilization, steam reforming, dry reforming or partial oxidation conditions

Sentencas: Several publications have addressed the thermodynamic analysis of the reforming of methanol (MeOH) and ethanol (EtOH) in SOFC, but none have considered the direct utilization of these fuels.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of solid oxide fuel cells operated with methanol and ethanol under direct utilization, steam reforming, dry reforming or partial oxidation conditions

Sentencas: The equilibrium compositions, the carbon deposition boundaries, and the electromotive forces for the direct utilization and partial oxidation of methanol and ethanol in SOFC as a function of the fuel utilization are obtained in this study.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of solid oxide fuel cells operated with methanol and ethanol under direct utilization, steam reforming, dry reforming or partial oxidation conditions

Sentencas: In addition, the minimum amounts of H2O, and CO2 for direct and indirect reforming with MeOH and EtOH to avoid carbon formation are calculated.
Titulo: Thermodynamic analysis of solid oxide fuel cells operated with methanol and ethanol under direct utilization, steam reforming, dry reforming or partial oxidation conditions
